event: The mouse is clicking on the desktop.
description: The mouse click on the desktop opens a context menu.

event: The mouse is clicking on the "Properties" option in the right-click context menu.
description: The user clicks on the "Properties" option in the right-click context menu. This opens a new window titled "Display Properties".
outcome: A new window titled "Display Properties" opened on the Windows XP desktop. The window contains a blank white space labeled "Window Text" and standard window controls. The previously open context menu is no longer visible, and the mouse cursor has changed to a standard pointer arrow.

event: The mouse is clicking on the "Screen Saver" tab of the "Display Properties" window.
description: The user clicks on the "Screen Saver" tab in the "Display Properties" window. As a result, the "Screen Saver" tab becomes active, replacing the "Desktop" tab content.
outcome: The "Display Properties" window is shown with the "Screen Saver" tab active. The "Screen saver:" dropdown menu is set to "Windows XP", and the preview window displays a blank screen with a small "Windows XP" logo.

event: The mouse is clicking on the down arrow of the "Screen saver" dropdown menu in the "Display Properties" window.
description: The user clicked the down arrow of the "Screen saver" dropdown menu in the "Display Properties" window. As a result, the dropdown menu opened, revealing a list of available screensavers.
outcome: The "Screen Saver" dropdown menu within the Windows XP "Display Properties" window was opened to reveal a list of available screensavers. The "(None)" option is highlighted, however, "Windows XP" remains selected as the active screensaver.

event: The mouse is clicking on empty space within the "Screen saver" dropdown menu of the "Display Properties" window.
description: The user clicked on the empty space within the open "Screen Saver" dropdown menu in the "Display Properties" window. As a result, the dropdown menu closed.
outcome: The "Screen saver" dropdown menu, which was likely open in a previous frame, is now closed.

event: The mouse is clicking on the "Power..." button within the "Display Properties" window.
description: The user clicks the "Power..." button located within the "Display Properties" window.
outcome: The "Power Options Properties" window opens. The "Power schemes" dropdown list shows "Home/Office Desk" is selected. The "Turn off hard disks" option is set to "After 20 mins".

event: The mouse pointer is clicking on the dropdown arrow of the "Power schemes" dropdown list in the "Power Options Properties" window.
description: The user clicks on the dropdown arrow of the "Power schemes" dropdown list to view the available power plan options.
outcome: The dropdown list for the "Power schemes" option expands, displaying options such as "Home/Office Desk", "Portable/Laptop", "Presentation", "Always On", "Minimal Power Management", and "Max Battery".

event: The mouse clicked on the "Presentation" item in the "Power schemes" dropdown menu of the "Power Options Properties" window.
description: The user clicked the "Always On" power scheme within the "Power schemes" dropdown menu.  As a result, the dropdown menu closed.
outcome: The "Power schemes" dropdown menu within the "Power Options Properties" window is no longer visible. The "Settings for Always On power scheme" section now displays "After 20 mins" for "Turn off hard disks", "Never" for “Turn off monitor”, "Never" for "System standby", and "Never" for "System hibernates".

event: The mouse is clicking on the dropdown button of the "Turn off hard disks" option in the "Power Options Properties" window.
description: The user clicks the dropdown arrow next to the "Turn off hard disks" option within the "Settings for Always On power scheme" section.
outcome: The "Turn off hard disks" dropdown menu expands, showing a list of time intervals ranging from "After 1 min" to "Never".

event: The mouse is clicking on the "Never" option in the "Turn off hard disks" dropdown menu within the "Power Options Properties" window.
description: The user clicks on "Never" in the "Turn off hard disks" dropdown menu to select it.  As a result, the dropdown menu closes.
outcome: The "Turn off hard disks" dropdown menu, previously expanded, is now closed.

event: The mouse is clicking on the "Apply" button in the "Power Options Properties" window.
description: The user clicks the "Apply" button at the bottom of the "Power Options Properties" window to save the changes made to the "Always On" power scheme.

event: The mouse is clicking on the "OK" button of the "Power Options Properties" window.
description: The user clicks the "OK" button at the bottom of the "Power Options Properties" window. This closes the "Power Options Properties" window.
outcome: The "Power Options Properties" window closed, returning the user to the "Display Properties" window with the "Screen Saver" tab active. The mouse cursor now hovers over the "OK" button of the "Display Properties" window.

event: The mouse is clicking on the "OK" button in the "Display Properties" window.
description: The user clicked the "OK" button in the "Display Properties" window.  As a result, the "Display Properties" window closed.
